general.byline: Researching concurrency testing, GPU parallelism in real-time systems, and databases
general.about:
I spend most of my time thinking about systems — distributed systems, real-time systems, databases, that sort of thing.

I've been programming since I was 9 (started with QBasic!), and I love working on problems that might actually help improve the world. Maybe open research is one way to do that. I really like this diagram by [Professor Matt Might](https://matt.might.net/articles/phd-school-in-pictures/) that visualizes what getting a PhD means:

![The Illustrated Guide to a PhD](https://cdn.spongeboi.com/the-illustrated-guide-to-a-phd1.jpg)

Outside of code, I have a deep appreciation for all forms of art and I'm really into [epistemology](https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/epistemology/) (the theory of knowledge). I love [Nietzsche's thoughts around art](https://bigthink.com/high-culture/nietzsche-art-life/). Music-wise, I <mark>love Stratocasters</mark> and listen to everything from blues to punk rock, sufi, and lots of indie jazz fusion.

Right now I'm researching probabilistic guarantees in concurrency testing and [exploring how GPU parallelism affects real-time systems](/reading/gpu-scheduling-edge-ai). I'm also really grateful to be <mark>interning at [PlanetScale](https://planetscale.com)</mark> where I get to work on <mark>[neki](https://neki.dev)</mark> (sharded postgres), learn from brilliant people about query planning and storage orchestration, and build fun side projects :)

Things I maintain here:

• <mark>[spongeboi's reading group](/reading)</mark> - a virtual shelf of interesting, fun, and some very essential essays, papers, books, websites, and blogs that I've read/found across the internet

items.heading: Research Intern
items.description:
- Working under Dr. Arpan Gujarati in collaboration with NVIDIA on real time systems research related to the Holoscan SDK (AI applications in Hospitals and Surgery Tables)
- Contributed to research that resulted in a paper accepted at RTSS 2025: <mark>["Faster, Exact, More General Response-time Analysis for NVIDIA Holoscan Applications"](https://2025.rtss.org/program/index.html)</mark>
- This internship is supported by the <mark>Work Learn International Undergraduate Research Award</mark>
